result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:29 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Christopher J Wright in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 210 days in Jefferson County Jail, withOUT Huber unless Judge Koschnick believes there is sufficient treatment plan in place; to commence forthwwith & concurrent 13CF402 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $268 + $250 DNA Surcharge = $518; due in $20 increments per month beginning 6/1/15 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until 9/1/15, then payments increase to $50 per month until paid in full; non-payment results in a 21 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given
Recess: 11:41 am
Status conference on December 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 8:32 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher J Wright in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Wright waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:35 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 11/19/14 at 1:00 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 12/5/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 10:45 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Christopher J Wright appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Plea of Not Guilty entered on misdemeanor; speedy trial waived
Atty Dahnert requests preliminary hearing be set within time limits
Court continues bond as previously set
Atty Dahnert orally motions for bond modification; presents argument
ADA Shock: No objection

The Court grants motion to modify bond and requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Laura Wright
--no presence at the residence of Laura Wright
--no presence at any pawn shop
--no possession of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, including syringes unless the syringes are being used for a documented medical purpose
Recess: 10: 50 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 10/31/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Attorney Dahnert
Copy of Letc. from SPD to Def. re: completion of paperwork
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:47am. [MK]
Defendant Christopher J Wright appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court confirms with Mr. Wright that he can see and hear the proceedings through the videoconferencing system.
Mr. Wright confirms that the address on the Complaint is his residence-address.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Right to counsel given. The Court instructs Mr. Wright to request a meeting with the PD attorney, through Jail Staff.
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance to allow time for Mr. Wright to seek counsel.

The Court requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Laura Wright
--no presence at the residence of Laura Wright
--no presence at any pawn shop
--no possession of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, including syringes unless the syringes are being used for a documented medical purpose
recess:9:53am. 

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/17/14 at 10:30am.
